body.name: Cuisinart CMW-200FR Cuisinart CMW-200FR 1.2-Cubic-Foot Convection Microwave Oven with Grill (Certified Refurbished), Silver
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 6 hrs 29 mins
features: 1000-watt countertop convection microwave oven and grill
1.2 cubic-foot interior; 12-inch rotating glass tray for even heating, External Dimensions: 20.4" x 18.9" x 12.4".
Touchpad control panel; 9 preset options, plus grill function; multi-stage cooking
Defrost by weight or time; reversible grill rack; instructions/recipes included
body.description: Cuisinart presents a countertop oven that's the ultimate combination of size, style and smarts. The big, 1.2 cubic foot Microwave Convection Oven and Grill looks like it belongs in a high-end commercial kitchen. Brushed stainless steel and black frame a sleek control panel that offers single and combinations settings for an unlimited number of cooking options. A multi-stage cooking feature that automatically shifts form one function to another makes perfect results easier than ever. This is a new generation of microwave - and It's from Cuisinart, of course!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This thing is a breeze
reviews.reviewText: Just a few days old, so read accordingly. We have baked using the convection feature, and while the baking was slower than I expected, everything came out fine. I assume that the power use is significantly lower than heating up the full size oven. As a microwave, this thing is a breeze, with a nice one-touch 30 second feature that you can press as often as you like, and other one touch features. The display is easy to read and clear. The quality seems like that of a commercial unit; heavy construction, stainless inside and out, solidly built. However, this doesn't eat up a lot of counter space. The noise level is very comfortable, other than the 5 beeps when something is finished. I'm still reading to see if that feature can be disarmed. At $200, this unit wasn't cheap, but with a 3 year warranty and the apparent quality of Cuisinart, I anticipate the purchase being worth the little bit extra over other brands. Looks cool too, and easy to see through the glass when cooking! Word of warning, Beach Camera here on Amazon sells these "refurbished", for $149. They claim the units are are like new. I got two in a row from them severely damaged and dented, and on the first, the carousel wouldn't spin. They claimed shipping problems, but neither shipping carton was at all damaged. Word to the wise: Avoid the headache, and if you can spend the little extra, get a new one and get the warranty.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2017
reviews.reviewText: This Microwave is VERY loud. I am not sure if it's just my product or this is true in general but it will make this very loud rattling noise when you try to start heating anything! it will continue to be very loud for the first 30seconds or so. Very loud motor sound when you are in the kitchen is so annoying! I am especially sensitive to loud vibration noise so this was horrible for me. I was able to return it since i only purchased it 2 weeks ago but this thing is very heavy, hence such a hassle to return. I now have to shop for a different microwave- what a pain. Perhaps conventional "simple" microwave ovens will be better.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best microwave/convection I ever owned.
reviews.reviewText: Awesome deal!! Works perfectly. This is a high quality item. Well worth the price compared to the standard Dept store cheaper models and works better than any other I have ever owned. Love the convection. So easy to clean. Packaging was perfect. I recommend this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2015
reviews.reviewText: unit works fine. can be tough to open as the handle doesn’t always open when the button is pushed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not for home use!
reviews.reviewText: This oven is so overrated! It takes longer than your home oven. Truth is... it just doesn't have enough watts to live up to it's design promises. We had hoped to replace both microwave and toaster oven with this boat anchor but boy were we wrong. Glad I bought the extended warranty because although the "return period" is over... they are going to make this piece of junk work. Do not buy this oven... even in an RV you would be better off just eating more beef jerky sitting in the sun.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Received package to APO shipping address. On arrival, ...
reviews.reviewText: Received package to APO shipping address. On arrival, box had minimal wear and tear....which in and of itself is unusual here. On opening package, glass plate is broken...not just broken...shattered. Thinking, OK, this is still workable. I can just order the replacement plate, and continue to utilize the convection oven. In looking at the product again, noticed that the shaft is missing that plate sits on. Unable to get a replacement through Cuisinart. So decide to return....THIS is the biggest frustration. This cost $93 and change to ship back. I was assured that I would be re-reimbursed for the cost of shipping, I will remain optimistic...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars GOOD VALUE & VERY ATTRACTIVE
reviews.reviewText: item arrived a day early, in great condition. . .actually looks new...VERY minor scratches on the top corner of this refurbished product. I tested everthing to be sure it works. Every function works perfectly, so far. Serveral reviews noted they thought the convection oven heated slowly. I don't find this to be the case at all...considering these are 110V I think it's pretty quick.. got up to 350 degrees in about 12 min. The buttons are pretty small,..somewhat difficult for an old guy like me to read. . .but not too bad, they are white letters/numbers on a black background. It's very attractive inside and out, Easy to use with the buttons well laid out. I especially like the 30 sec button that you can push repeatedly for 30 sec, 60 sec, 90 sec, etc, , then it starts the micowave immediately. The only reason I didn't give this refurbished unit 5 stars is the door latch. It's really awful . .as noted by many reviews of those who purchased the new one, not even refurbished. It closes very easily, but pushing the button doen't always open without having to pull under the door frame at the same time. This is VERY Annoying! I have a Panasonic commercial microwave wth a simple handle. . .it works so much better than the push button door. I don't understand why most microwave have a push button door when a handle works so mch better. I'll write another review if something goes wrong in the near futher, but so far I'm pleased with this Cuisinart Convection Microwave.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Purchased to use in our 5th wheel. Have had for few years and have had no issues.
